-   Spiegelman D, Carroll RJ, Kipnis V. Efficient regression calibration
    for logistic regression in main study/internal validation study
    designs with an imperfect reference instrument. Statistics in
    Medicine. 2001:20(1):139-160.
    [doi:10.1002/1097-0258(20010115)20:1\<139::AID-SIM644\>3.0.CO;2-K](https://doi.org/10.1002/1097-0258(20010115)20:1%3C139::AID-SIM644%3E3.0.CO;2-K)

This package for R implements measurement error correction methods for
measurement error in a continuous covariate or outcome in a linear model
with a continuous outcome.

The package can be installed via

``` r
devtools::install_github("LindaNab/mecor", build_vignettes = TRUE)
```

result.description: This prerelease releases a new version of mecor using the MeasError object. It implements regression calibration and efficient regression calibration if there is measurement error in the independent variable, in case of a validation study. Further, it implements regression calibration if there is measurement error in the independent variable, in case of a replicate study.
result.name: Regression calibration and efficient regression calibration

result.description: This pre-release releases the functionality as described in the paper "Measurement Error in Continuous Endpoints in Randomised Trials: Problems and Solutions".  It provides a corrected estimator and several methods to construct its confidence intervals for both systematic and differential measurement error in continuous endpoints, by using information from an external calibration set.
result.name: Measurement error correction for continuous endpoints

result.value:
``` r
library(mecor)
# load the internal covariate validation study
data("vat", package = "mecor")
head(vat)
# correct the biased exposure-outcome association
mecor(ir_ln ~ MeasError(substitute = wc, reference = vat) + age + sex + tbf, data = vat, method = "standard")
```

Browse the vignettes of the package for more information.

``` r
browseVignettes(package = "mecor")
```
